answers.answer: A neuro-endocrinologist - in other words, an endo that works with the pituitary, would be able to help you more.Most endos just do diabetes and thyroid (and that, I would say, marginally) so you need a good one. Even some of the neuro-endos are iffy so you need to ask around, and you may see a few before you find "the one".

question: I have been watching this forum, and also put a post on this forum, and was told that an Endocrinologist is NOT the kind of expert doctor that I needed.   I stated that I have gained a substantial amount of weight and have hypothyroidism, and that my Endo thought my cortisol levels would be extremely high.  The only test she did was a 24 hr. urine test, which showed my cortisol levels were extremely LOW.  But I have all the symptoms of them being high.  I was told that I needed a lot more tests, and I needed to see an expert.I thought an Endo WAS the expert?  Does anyone know what kind of doctor I need?  I would appreciate any response, especially if you know what kind of doctor I need to go to.   My PCP is clueless.Thank you.
title: WHAT KIND OF DOCTOR DO I NEED??
